snippet: In a decision that could fundamentally reshape public education in the state, a judge on Wednesday ordered changes in everything from how schools are financed to how teachers are paid and evaluated....
abstract: Judge Thomas Moukawsher of State Superior Court in Hartford orders Connecticut to overhaul nearly every aspect of its education system, accusing state of defaulting on constitutional duty to provide adequate education to all children; decision was delivered in response to suit filed in 2005 that claimed state was shortchanging funding for schools in poorest districts.
lead_paragraph: In a decision that could fundamentally reshape public education in the state, a judge on Wednesday ordered changes in everything from how schools are financed to how teachers are paid and evaluated.

headline.main: Judge, Citing Inequality, Orders Connecticut to Overhaul Its School System
headline.print_headline: Connecticut Told to Start Over as a Judge Faults Its Schools
